| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1872](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1872 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **koala**, z, is a type of [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [zouthern animal](/wiki/Zouthern_animal "Zouthern animal") that can [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible"), and possesses a unique calming touch attack that can abort [techniques](/wiki/Technique "Technique") against [you](/wiki/You "You") and renders monsters peaceful, and deals no direct damage in either case.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A koala's diet consists entirely of [eucalyptus leaves](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaves "Eucalyptus leaves"), and throwing the leaves at a koala will [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame") them.

## Strategy

To the player themselves, koalas are harmless: their ability to disrupt techniques is insignificant, and their attacks deal no direct damage. The koala's primary threat lies in its ability to untame any pet that it hits with its touch attack, which can include rare and difficult-to-tame pets. Players who rely heavily on pets should make taking out koalas a priority, as even a peaceful [Solar](/wiki/Solar "Solar") is about as useful as a dead one to most [pacifists](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist"); peaceful koalas are just as dangerous since pets will still attack them, giving the koala a chance to retaliate and potentially untame them. Notably, the attack does *not* check [monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance") or any other property, meaning that the only defense pets have against this attack is [AC](/wiki/AC "AC") to avoid being hit by it in the first place - and even that is never a guarantee.

A koala's poor AC and low monster MR of 10 (which makes it the only monster among the zouthern animals to have any) makes them easy to take down, although their higher-than-expected base level means doing so will take a few hits. While the koala's calming ability could make it a powerful pet in theory, in practice its slow speed and poor defenses combine to make it fairly impractical as one.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Koala](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koala "wikipedia:Koala")***

The koala, sometimes called "koala bear", is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia. It is found in coastal areas of the mainland's eastern and southern regions, inhabiting Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria, and South Australia. A koala is easily recognizable by its stout, tailless body and large head with round, fluffy ears and large, spoon-shaped nose. Koalas typically inhabit open Eucalyptus woodland, as the leaves of these trees make up most of their diet - this diet has low nutritional and caloric content, and the leaves contain toxic compounds that deter most other mammals from feeding on it.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [mhitm.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1768](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/mhitm.c#line1768 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/mhitm.c"): *The only monsters that resist are those that cannot normally be made peaceful anyway.*

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Koala

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
z koala
Difficulty 8
Attacks Touch calm
z koala
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Touch calm

Base level 7
Base experience 95
Speed 4
Base AC 9
Base MR 10
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 150
Nutritional value 50
Size Small
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed None

A koala:

  • is an animal.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is herbivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1872

A koala, z, is a type of animal that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, SpliceHack, and Hack'EM. It is a herbivorous domestic zouthern animal that can see invisible, and possesses a unique calming touch attack that can abort techniques against you and renders monsters peaceful, and deals no direct damage in either case.[1]

A koala's diet consists entirely of eucalyptus leaves, and throwing the leaves at a koala will tame them.

Strategy

To the player themselves, koalas are harmless: their ability to disrupt techniques is insignificant, and their attacks deal no direct damage. The koala's primary threat lies in its ability to untame any pet that it hits with its touch attack, which can include rare and difficult-to-tame pets. Players who rely heavily on pets should make taking out koalas a priority, as even a peaceful Solar is about as useful as a dead one to most pacifists; peaceful koalas are just as dangerous since pets will still attack them, giving the koala a chance to retaliate and potentially untame them. Notably, the attack does not check monster magic resistance or any other property, meaning that the only defense pets have against this attack is AC to avoid being hit by it in the first place - and even that is never a guarantee.

A koala's poor AC and low monster MR of 10 (which makes it the only monster among the zouthern animals to have any) makes them easy to take down, although their higher-than-expected base level means doing so will take a few hits. While the koala's calming ability could make it a powerful pet in theory, in practice its slow speed and poor defenses combine to make it fairly impractical as one.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Koala

The koala, sometimes called "koala bear", is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia. It is found in coastal areas of the mainland's eastern and southern regions, inhabiting Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria, and South Australia. A koala is easily recognizable by its stout, tailless body and large head with round, fluffy ears and large, spoon-shaped nose. Koalas typically inhabit open Eucalyptus woodland, as the leaves of these trees make up most of their diet - this diet has low nutritional and caloric content, and the leaves contain toxic compounds that deter most other mammals from feeding on it.

References

  1. ↑ mhitm.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1768: The only monsters that resist are those that cannot normally be made peaceful anyway.

A '''koala''', {{monsym|koala}}, is a type of [[animal]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]], [[SpliceHack]], and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a [[herbivorous]] [[domestic]] [[zouthern animal]] that can [[see invisible]], and possesses a unique calming touch attack that can abort [[technique]]s against [[you]] and renders monsters peaceful, and deals no direct damage in either case.{{refsrc|mhitm.c|1768|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2|comment=The only monsters that resist are those that cannot normally be made peaceful anyway.}}

A koala's diet consists entirely of [[eucalyptus leaves]], and throwing the leaves at a koala will [[tame]] them.

==Strategy==
To the player themselves, koalas are harmless: their ability to disrupt techniques is insignificant, and their attacks deal no direct damage. The koala's primary threat lies in its ability to untame any pet that it hits with its touch attack, which can include rare and difficult-to-tame pets. Players who rely heavily on pets should make taking out koalas a priority, as even a peaceful [[Solar]] is about as useful as a dead one to most [[pacifist]]s; peaceful koalas are just as dangerous since pets will still attack them, giving the koala a chance to retaliate and potentially untame them. Notably, the attack does ''not'' check [[monster magic resistance]] or any other property, meaning that the only defense pets have against this attack is [[AC]] to avoid being hit by it in the first place - and even that is never a guarantee.

A koala's poor AC and low monster MR of 10 (which makes it the only monster among the zouthern animals to have any) makes them easy to take down, although their higher-than-expected base level means doing so will take a few hits. While the koala's calming ability could make it a powerful pet in theory, in practice its slow speed and poor defenses combine to make it fairly impractical as one.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Koala}}
The koala, sometimes called "koala bear", is an arboreal herbivorous marsupial native to Australia. It is found in coastal areas of the mainland's eastern and southern regions, inhabiting Queensland, New South Wales, Victoria, and South Australia. A koala is easily recognizable by its stout, tailless body and large head with round, fluffy ears and large, spoon-shaped nose. Koalas typically inhabit open Eucalyptus woodland, as the leaves of these trees make up most of their diet - this diet has low nutritional and caloric content, and the leaves contain toxic compounds that deter most other mammals from feeding on it.
